author: .paulharris
content:
Was looking at logs from the devnet last night 
128 - empty (capella, epoch transition)
129 - rejected by EL with a message that nill withdrawals was expected
130 - rejected with same message
131 - empty
132 - empty
133 - first capella block accepted

There's a lot of rejected gossip in that period i'm yet to dig into.
I'm not 100% sure if we called FcUv2 because of the work-arounds in place in teku for calling v1 endpoints until capella, I'm still hopeful that we'll be able to eventually call v2 endpoints prior to capella as the EL spec suggests we should be able to...

author: .paulharris
content: i think the gossip is mostly a teku issue that Adrian is digging into by the sounds

author: barnabasbusa
content:
I have setup the genesis file with the following
```
GENESIS_FORK_VERSION: 0x10000040
ALTAIR_FORK_VERSION: 0x10000040
BELLATRIX_FORK_VERSION: 0x10000040
CAPELLA_FORK_VERSION: 0x40000040``` I have done this as previously I found out that different clients will report different genesis versions (which might be a bug in the other clients)

barnabasbusa

author: siladu
content:
This is fixed on our branch, latest code works with teku locally. Can look at getting another image out today. 
While the 'shanghaiTimestamp' fork is being worked on, I have to put a fix in to allow V1 post-shanghai which should mean shanghaiBlock can be triggered before capella and avoids having to have the forks perfectly aligned.

author: barnabasbusa
content: Just focus on the timestamp imo.

author: barnabasbusa
content: No need for hot fixes

author: potuz
content: also that could never happen, since it can't work for the CL, and your engine API has to return an error if we send you an empty withdrawals list before capella

author: barnabasbusa
content: Can you point me to your cappella branch?

author: potuz
content: so I don't understand what that hotfix can do <@341574016160497665>

author: potuz
content: I mean, we would start calling V2 right at Capella

author: siladu
content: https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/pull/4552

author: siladu
content:
At one point, teku was sending V1 requests post-capella (e.g. for backfilling pre-capella blocks). It's possible that's not the case anymore, need to check.
The other reason is besu can't support a timestamp fork yet, so we had to align shanghaiBlock with capella precisely and that was causing issues on devnets that didn't start everything from block/slot 0.

author: barnabasbusa
content: Oh missing block 32 might have been an index +-1

author: barnabasbusa
content: Bc we start from slot 0 and block 0

author: potuz
content: We would certainly continue sending you V1 requests when syncing for example pre-capella block. But my point is that you can't really work your way around the timestamp issue with these methods cause say you somehow trigger internally a shanghai block before the actual capella fork happens. Then the EL will be happy to take bad blocks with withdrawals before Capella actually happens. It would also not complain if a client didn't fork and send a null withdrawals list after Capella.

author: sproul
content: fully supported in Lighthouse as of me merging this PR a minute ago: <https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/pull/3726>

author: ajsutton
content: BLS to execution changes are supported in Teku now.  The REST API to actually submit them to us is just being finished off and I'm not sure we include them in blocks yet, but no problem gossiping them or processing if someone else can shove them into blocks.

author: ajsutton
content: Although as you may guess from the state of the REST API - it hasn't had real world testing yet. üòÑ

author: .paulharris
content:
In terms of withdrawals boundary conditions
 - last block of bellatrix is late
- first block of capella comes in (fCuv2, newPayloadV2)
- last block of bellatrix arrives...

CL would send newPayloadV2 with null withdrawals by spec is my understanding - once v2 is compatible I guess, is that what EL is expecting?

author: potuz
content: what matters is the timestamp of the payload, and that determines what the EL should expect. So in the case of the late Bellatrix block, if it has a valid timestamp, it will still be before the Capella fork and the EL would take it as valid

author: .paulharris
content: my understanding is as EL currently stands it would expect me to call newPayloadV1, but by spec v2 with null withdrawals will be correct... yes?

author: potuz
content: yes, V2 with null withdrawals is correct

author: potuz
content: just for the record, the easiest I could think to cause zero confusion here is the obvious, we call the engine methods based on the version of the block

author: potuz
content: no matter if they internally call V1 anyway

author: .paulharris
content: that just means can never get rid of v1 code, which is not awesome... i think the intent was to be able to remove v1 at some point

author: potuz
content: don't ask me... I honestly rarely understand the decisions made on API world
